awd_titl_txt: Heterolytic and Homolytic Dissociations of Organic Acids
awd_abstract_narration: With funding from the Organic Dynamics Program Professor Bordwell of   Northwestern University will measure bond dissociation enthalpies (BDE)   for the cleavage of weak acids, HA, by combining the oxidation potentials   of the conjugate anions, A-, with the negative logarithm of the acidity   constant of the acid in dimethyl sulfoxide (DMSO). Fundamental   thermodynamic parameters, vital to computational methods and to molecular   modeling studies, will be obtained for complex compounds for which   extrapolated values of BDE from other data are unreliable.    This project will measure by a method using compounds dissolved in   liquids and different from standard methods that require gas phase   studies, the energy required to break selected bonds in carbon containing   molecules. This contribution is vital to current efforts to model by   computer computations  the chemical reactions and physical properties of   complex carbon containing compounds.
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Mathematical and Physical Sciences
